newsitem.title: UK: Orient Semiconductor sets $70 mln convertible bond.
newsitem.headline: Orient Semiconductor sets $70 mln convertible bond.

text.p: Orient Semiconductor Electronics, Ltd has issued a $70 million convertible bond due December 28, 2003, priced at par and with a coupon of 1.50 percent, lead manager Bankers Trust International said.
There is a $10 million Greenshoe option.
The Luxembourg-listed bonds will be convertible into ordinary shares of OSE. The conversion price is NT$45.65 per share and the bonds are convertible until November 28, 2003.
On December 28, 1998 and December 28, 1999 the conversion price may be adjusted downwards by no less than 80 percent.

There is a call option from December 28, 1999 subject to a 140 percent share price hurdle. There is also a put option on December 28, 2001 at 135.37 percent to yield 145 basis points over U.S. Treasuries.
